intro: Vincetoxicum taiwanense, commonly known as Taiwan false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its fruits are follicles that contain seeds with a tuft of silky hairs. Vincetoxicum taiwanense is often found in moist, shaded areas and is considered a decorative plant in horticulture.
